people_also_ask.question: What are seat cushions called?
people_also_ask.heading: It may be used for sitting or kneeling upon, or to soften the hardness or angularity of a chair or couch. Decorative cushions often have a patterned cover material, and are used as decoration for furniture. A cushion is also referred to as a bolster, hassock, headrest, a tush, and a sham.
people_also_ask.title: Cushion - Wikipedia

people_also_ask.question: Are seat cushions bad for your back?
people_also_ask.heading: For relief from slouching and slumping, you need a back cushion that will keep your spine aligned in a neutral position. “The shape of [a lumbar] cushion ideally matches the natural curve of your spine and the bottom of the pillow should support the sacrum or tailbone,” says Eby.10-Nov-2021
people_also_ask.title: The 7 Best Seat Cushions for Lower Back Pain of 2021

people_also_ask.question: How thick should seat cushions be?
people_also_ask.heading: In general, cushions of at least 50mm thick will be comfortable enough for a seating pad, 75mm for a bench or window seat, and approximately 100mm for a daybed.13-Aug-2014
people_also_ask.title: What thickness cushion do I need?
